page.title: 12CO-OP FARMING IN OADBY
page.content: CO-OP FARMING began in 1896.In 1985 it farmed 34,011 acres.It had 5 arable farms,2 fruit farms,3 glass farms,6 dairy farms and 1 hill farm from Essex to Aberdeen.It produced sugar beet, peas,tomatoes,pears,strawberries,cider and desert apples,blackcurrants and potatoes for sale in its nationwide chain of stores.It was a milk retail producer and kept 4,850 dairy cows and 2,260 followers.It kept 1,200 black faced ewes. STOUGHTON ESTATE,Leic.was the biggest co-op farm 5,100 acres purchased in 1919.In 1066 it belonged to Hugh de Grentenaisnell,60 acres of meadow and 22 acres of ploughland value Â£9.It has had many owners including Leicester Abbey and Convent.In 1553 it was farmed by Thomas Farnham and passed through the same family until the death of Harry L.Powys-Keck in 1912.
